page.title: 08TOURISM ON MENDIP
page.content: The block lies at the top of{Cheddar {Gorge}which, along with its caves, is one of the busiest tourist centres in the country. Footpaths allow tourists the opportunity to gain access to the pleasant countryside in the area, including nature reserves at{Black {Rock, Velvet Bottom & Longwood.} Picnics are popular here, several tracts of land are owned by the{ {National Trust.}Tourism does bring its problems_litter, noise, congestion, pollution & high prices in some shops. One suggestion to ease these problems, was to close Cheddar Gorge to traffic in the summer. It would mean large car parks being built. Despite the pressures the area benefits from tourism.
